website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma MX700 is a great choice for small offices with a wide variety of print tasks. This inkjet multifunction beats out the competition with a winning combination of features and performance.
pros: memory card slots and PictBridge port
cons: PictBridge port can't be used for USB flash or HDD devices

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay for a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer and it worked well when I first got it. Now the black ink won't print. I have changed the cartridge and even performed the self cleaning ritual various times. It still wont print the black and white, however, color is fine. The alignment is now 'off' and it doesn't print anything readable anymore. I have googled various sites to find help, and many say the same thing...it was fine when they first bought it. The sites say to trash it and buy another brand. Needless to say, I wont be buying Canon printers anymore.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hammaker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Canon all in one. I replaced it because one of the colors (cayan) stopped working. This happened after I started getting cartridges at one of the refill stores. Of course I have no way of knowing if that was the issue, but I suspect it was. So far the new printer has worked flawlessly. It has done a good job of DVD labels and photos. It is slower than my previous Canon, but the price was right and I feel that it is a little more conserving on the ink. I intend to only use Canon ink which I get from Cosco for only a little bit more then the refills.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wolfson

customer_reviews.title: Geat value all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: Most of the equipment I buy is HP. I have had a few Canon & Epson printers in the past, with reasonable satisfaction, but generally default to HP. I read several reviews on the MX700 and competitive products, and decided to go with the MX700. I am very pleased with the print quality, setup, and am particularly impressed with the software that came with the printer. My only nitpick is a slow first page, but that really isn't an important issue. Bottom line - I'd pick the MX700 all over again after using it for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Warren White

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX700
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this printer for 5 weeks. We use the printer mainly for printing text. The printer is fast and text is sharp and clear. Color images also look good (the few we have printed so far). Scanned images are clear and you have the option to save the image to pdf format. Copying is quick and easy. We don't use the fax so I can not comment on that feature. This printer uses 4 individual ink tanks so you only replace the color that is empty which saves money. Overall - a very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I have been using it for quite a while and it is working very nicely. A little noisier than my other one
customer_reviews.text: This product is just as described by seller. I have been using it for quite a while and it is working very nicely. A little noisier than my other one, but that is very tolerable. Thanks to a great seller. Also the communication with this seller was exceptional
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good printer great price
customer_reviews.text: After doing some searching and looking at HP, Brother, and a couple of other printer makers, I settled on the Cannon MX700. Lots of function, great price and in a nice sized package. I wanted a single printer that multiple computers in the house could print to easily. The printer was very easy to setup and connect to my home network, now we can print from wherever we are in the house. The speed is good and the print quality is excellent. Would strongly recommend this printer, especially at the Amazon price. Bonus feature, our cat loves it too, he will come racing in to watch it when it starts a print job.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Here there every which way
customer_reviews.text: The Canon was easy to set up. Plug in, inserted disc. All went as it was supposed to. The trickiest part is figuring both front and rear and top paper feeds. It's a bit more than I need as far as fax goes, (with home use I rarely send faxes, but nice to have capability. But was more interested in printing, documents, drawings,etc., scaning photos, and drawings for projects, plus it accepts memory card from my camera and printing pictures, is great. Did not have problems with cleaning printer heads as others have reported. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Simply Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a year now and haven't had a single issue with it. It's fast, prints with excellent quality, and scans perfectly. Copier and fax work perfectly as well. I have rarely been so happy with a product as I am with this so I felt the need to post a review. I printed my wedding programs on this thing and they turned out wonderfully. Also, I have used this printer heavily on a daily basis and again, not a single issue. What more praise can you give a printer? Buy it. The negative reviews must have gotten lemons.
customer_reviews.author: Pete C

customer_reviews.title: printer setup was straight forward
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems getting the Canon PIXMA MX700 Office All-On-One Inkjet Printer setup. Followed the instructions carefully and was able to set it up in short order. Read the instructions carefully before starting the setup. More instructions to get it to work from the router. This is one of the reasons that I bought this printer, it will work on the network with out the need of a computer to operate it. Still fairly new but so far it has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Womble

customer_reviews.title: Printhead failed after only 6 years of medium use
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so maybe these things aren't designed to last that long, but think of the waste...wasted electronics in a landfill (unless you recycle, which can be a hassle in and of itself), wasted $$$ on ink when it dies, wasted time trouble shooting, print capability down time, etc., all because the replacement print head costs the same as just buying a whole new printer. Decent printer while it worked, but very wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and full of features
customer_reviews.text: I had been buying HP printers for a while. I had a Canon MFP a while back that had very bad drivers. I decided to give Canon another try and I'm very happy. It has a much smaller footprint than my Wife's HP MFP and the design is very pleasing to the eye. The ink is easy to replace and I set it up on the network for my home PC and via USB from the docking station for my work laptop without issue. I couldn't be happier with the quality, design and user friendly setup.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Ridge Blues

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Our (very small) office has just started to "scan-to-disc" some of our old office and client files. The Canon MX700 has been an ideal tool for the scanning of these old files. The extra pluses are the color printer (not actually needed but a great deal of fun!) and possible fax capabilities if our dedicated fax machine should fail for any reason. Software is super friendly Our office is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: L. Buglion

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Canon printer I have tried. I needed to get a printer that could scan and save in PDF format. I'm so pleased with the quality and performance with this printer. It's not the fastest, but plenty adequate. While I didn't buy it to print pictures ( I use my Epson 1800 for that), I tried to print some, and was amazed at the results...very true color and quality was surprising. The price was great and I would certainly recommend this printer!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thunquest

customer_reviews.title: You cant beat this all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about it because of the price. Its great though easy to use right out of the box. well i mean install the drivers then its easy as cake. Button layout nice and ots of function. Interface not confusing and very dummy proof scanns prints like a champ at the price. although i havent used the fax feature so take into consideration. i wouldnt trade this printer for any other one. its the poor mans caddie of printers.
customer_reviews.author: William Settle

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX 700 printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up. It prints text quickly and the pictures are very good. The price was good and the delivery service was outstanding. I would give the service and the printer an "A".Follow up in 2012: The printer power supply failed and parts were not available. It did print very well for a while. I had to junk it and buy a new printer. I did get good service from it while it was working. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Better than Lexmark X4550
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Lexmark first and returned it because the wifi feature did not work with both my pc and my mac. Also the scanner created large files by default and could not be configured to create lower resolution files. I have had the Canon for 2 years now and love it: simple, fast, good printing quality. Note that I am not a heavy user (<100 pages / week). Note that I am not a user of the fax function.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Better than the HP
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little all-in-one printer. I have a very small office space and it fits perfectly on a lamp table next to my desk. It operates efficiently and, compared the HP in my main office, quietly. It's not the fastest thing in the world, but speed was not what I was looking for. Printing quality is very good. I had a question about scanning and the customer service people (in the U.S.!) were quite helpful. I like this printer much better than the HP L7700 and wish I'd done more research before buying the other.
customer_reviews.author: John-David Longwell

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this All in One
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a Lexmark All in One. The scanner/fax regularly would not properly scan or fax (documents would be cut off or be different sizes) and finally the fax went out completely. The ink usage was awful. With the Canon I have scanned in over 150 documents at one time and all were done perfectly. Granted this is not intended to be a high speed scanner, but it did the job I needed it to do. Software is easy to use and set up was a breeze. I'm still on the low volume ink cartidges so it hasn't sucked up a ton of ink.
customer_reviews.author: NotGuilty

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a printer that could do multiple things, this is it. It will print out amazing picture quality, fantastic paper quality and scan to my computer well too. I haven't used the Fax feature yet, but I'm sure it works as well as everything else does. It even comes with a photo program so I can print multiple pictures to one page or just a 4x6 or a full page picture, which is great quality by the way. I HIGHLY recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX700
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good printer/scan/copier and I think a good fax too, but, never used this option so far. Though, the initial printing copying does take a while for the copier/printer to spool up (about a minute), but, it gets going fast after that. Quality of prints and copy is quite good and it has many futures that I've yet to explore including using the direct memory card interface.
customer_reviews.author: Arman

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma 700 a great inkjet printer
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Pixma model 700 I bought is a replacement for a 530 model that I had used for about 3 years that became defective by leaving a soaking, wide black line in the middle of the back of the printed page. I went through the troubleshooting suggestions from Canon Help to no avail, and the cost to have a service repair facility check it out was not cost effective. I liked the printing quality of the 530, so I bought a new 700 via Amazon.com, which has unbeatable prices and free shipping. The new 700 also does a great printing job, including photo printing. I just hope that the fearsome black streak defect never happens again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer
customer_reviews.text: We are extremely pleased at our purchase of the Canon Pixma MX700 printer. Installation and set-up was very easy. We LOVE the network printing capabilities, no longer do we have to ensure a PC is turned on for network printing. Wanted to send a fax and once a phone cable was connected we sent one without ever viewing the manual. Printing and copy functions are top shelf.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine!
customer_reviews.text: This was about my favourite printer/copier... all in one machine.... I loved that all of the ink cartridges were clear so that I could see when they needed filling... each colour had its own cartridge, too.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stavert

customer_reviews.title: 4-In-1
customer_reviews.text: The Pixma MX700 has been a great performer. I previously had an HP 4-in-1 printer before that gave fair service but this Canon printer has outlasted and performed way better. This particular printer is a cable-connected device to my PC. When this one dies, I will surely consider Canon again and move on to a wireless version for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley C.

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX700 Office All-On-One Inkjet Printer
customer_reviews.text: Love it but sometimes I have a problem doing things I have done on it for a while but thats me not the printer. I Have a friend that has one to we both love it . It does real good one ink he just replaced his color ink after one year, now the black we both had to replace after about 6 months. The ink is not real expensive but you have to use canon ink the off brands will mess it up. I have had mine for about 6 months and my friend one year.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Mellon

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years Later - No Issues, Still running strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in January of 2009. It is now almost December of 2012. I use this on a daily basis for printing, scanning and, copying. It has worked nearly flawlessly over this time. I have gone through many printers in my life and this one stands up as the best yet. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lonneville

customer_reviews.title: Good on ink
customer_reviews.text: Good network solution if you're wanting to upgrade at a reasonable price point. No wifi connection is a minus and setup on some xp machines is tricky I had to manually add the printer on one machine since the setup cd couldn't seem to install the printer even though it found it on the network, but overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage...Garbage...Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Please...Please...Please ignore all good reviews of this product. This product is something that even Toys-r-us would be ashamed of stocking on one of its toy shelves. It jams too frequently on print jobs (i.e., when loading paper). It is noisy. It is slow. Will basically accept only a few sheets of paper for print jobs...otherwise it jams! Copier is OK. Have not tried fax yet. This multi-printer is a multi-piece of junk. As far as printing...give me back my Epson, any Epson!
customer_reviews.author: R. Woodbury

customer_reviews.title: Seems good, but it's too new to really tell...
customer_reviews.text: I love these reviews because one hasn't had the product long enough to find out if the product is a dork up in the making. I'm thinking it's not, but I've completed feedback like this on sayyy shoes I've purchased that a year later I would have totally changed my feedback had I the opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: Good Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Not too impressed
customer_reviews.text: The photo prints are poor quality, and goes through a lot of ink in just one photo. Not too impressed wish I had bought a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Complete Unit!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon MX700 is a multi-functional machine that doesn't take up much office space. The individual color cartridges give me flexibility when printing as I use more blue ink. The ability to scan, fax, and print in either color or b&w makes this unit a great value for my home office needs.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Tsangaris

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX700
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped quickly and arrived in excellent shape. This is an excellent all in one printer/fax/copier/scan machine. I use it for home and home office use. I would recommend it to anyone. Customer support is excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Sage

customer_reviews.title: canon all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: great little printer, although it isn't that little in size. just haven't gotten around to using the fax feature as i am having a bit of a problem setting it up. cnet has rated this high and amazon offered a good deal. you should not go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen L. Woo

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer with superb quality. I'm very happy with it, although it can be difficult to get the scanning functions to work if you are not very computer-savy (same with networking of it). That said, I got it all working fine and I'm quite pleased with the results. It has also survived a move from MA to OH without anything breaking so I would say it's a fairly well built piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Rise

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Canon Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have always stuck with Canon and this one met or exceeded my expectations and with the single color ink cartridges you will save some serious dough. Very easy to setup and looks sharp. The LCD screen is small but definitely readable. Good Value!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Mccluskey

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX700 Review
customer_reviews.text: Excellenct product. Fast printing and copying. Easy to use. I have this on my home network. I like to sit in my living room with my laptop and print items to this printer which is in my home office. Works perfect. I had a print server before that had to be rebooted several times a month. Not this printer it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Eshleman

customer_reviews.title: bargain printer
customer_reviews.text: great printer for the price (honestly, it felt like i was getting it for free)... the only complaint i have is that there is no covered paper tray in which i can leave a stack of paper... you have to leave the output tray fully open in order to leave a stack (which i dont like to do since it is easy to bump into and break off)... but features and print quality are on par with all others in this category
customer_reviews.author: The Bear

customer_reviews.title: Canon MX700 printer is cool
customer_reviews.text: This printer/scanner/fax works great as a network printer and has some cool features such as 2 paper trays and Canon's seperate ink tanks. Although the footprint is rather large, it looks very handsome on a computer desk and is a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good all purpose printer. A bit complicated to set up, but if you follow the instructions, eventually you'll get there. Still haven't figured out how to work the fax without getting the incoming phonecalls interrupted by the fax signal.
customer_reviews.author: NYCLoftdweller

customer_reviews.title: Nice, basic color printer
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for light use. Our small office uses it for the occasional color copy and as an "extra" printer that guests at our office can use or we can take along with us to a trade show. We are not using the fax features at all. It is working fine. Occasionally, it feeds a piece of paper just a little crooked, but I'm not sure if that is the printer or us not putting it in carefully. Our usage is so light, we are still using the starter ink so I have no feedback on maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: pjd

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, cheap, easy setup, great print quality
customer_reviews.text: I havent really done any serious photo printing with this - its more of an office printer - but for basic printing tasks its great, easy to setup, easy to use, very usable controls. I used these to print my placecards for our wedding with high-quality setting, and they came out perfectly. For printers and digital cameras, I always go with Canon and am never dissapointed. I have had 3 Canon powershots and 3 Canon inkjets, and they have all been superior products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Canon
customer_reviews.text: This printer could not be more perfect for your simple home office. Professionals may find the need for more bells and whistles, but to just get the job done at home, this works. Great quality, great price, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharin

customer_reviews.title: excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I used to by HP printers but they are junk, this Cannon MX700 is a great printer and its wireless when pluged into your router. I also have a Cannon 850 at my office that gets quite a workout and has never let me down. I'm sold on Cannon!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-in-one.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is an excellent home all-in-one. I had an HP 7200 before buying this. This is slower for copying but it handles pictures well. Ink is more reasonable and print quality is better for around 40% the price. A breeze to install with no conflicts. I would highly recommend this to any home user.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon E.

customer_reviews.title: Best Multi-Function Out There
customer_reviews.text: By far the Canon PIXMA MX700 blows the competition away. Ease of installation, networking, multiple paper feeds, 30 sheet fax, scan and copy feeder. Great quality at a great price. I replaced an HP Multi-Function with the Canon and couldn't be happier. With the networking and new software I can print, scan, fax etc. from any of the three computers in my home, couldn't do that with the HP even with a networked print server attached. Canon gets a thumbs up on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: A great home-office printer copier
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've had my printer/copier about a month now, and it has done everything I've asked it to, which -- like the person who never wins anything -- never really happens to me. There's always something. I love this printer -- the color is much more intense than my HP and the ink supply seems to be holding up pretty well. I have had no jamming. It even prints envelopes, which never happened before.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Fritschner

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: after 3 mos, it broke and tried to repair it, even using computer help but unrepairable. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Neslund

customer_reviews.title: Graduate school
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully made and operating product that I have not had the time to test all of it's capabilities. Like so many electronic products making their appearance, each generation is progressively more complex than the previous to the point that, at times, they beome cumbersome and hard to use. By the time the user gets to be ninety years old, simply inserting a piece of paper and giving the knob on the platten a spin and then typing would be a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me ( I need Network Printing)
customer_reviews.text: THis is a really great printer. Setup is simple and easy to do, this is my 4th one, and I just connect it to routers, and it does its thing.
customer_reviews.author: Estel J. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Really Good All-In-One
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a month and I'm really happy with it. The scans and the prints look good. It feeds paper reliably. And I was able to connect it to my home network without a problem. I haven't tried the fax or tried to print photos.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N.

customer_reviews.title: Canon's great all-in-one printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for my Grandkids because their HP Photosmart became not so smart. I liked it so much that I ordered another one for me. It also works great on my network.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Brinkley

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this printer about two months but it works fine for my purposes. It prints both text and pictures. My HP had trouble dealing with glossy photo paper. I have not encountered this problem with this printer. I cannot comment on the FAX function as I have not used it.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up and operational proceedures.All functions work very well. Very satisfied with this all-in one printer.
customer_reviews.author: Irving J. Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX700
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good purchase. Easy to set up and a great all in one. I would definitely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The printer was easy to setup and use, quiet, and fast. For this price, though, it could use a duplexer.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Nice all-in-one printer at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well and prints pretty good photographs. It is easy to operate and makes good copies. I only used the fax once, but it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Electra

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer! Easy to set up, very easy to use. The driver software includes some very robust options. Picture quality is fantastic. We are very, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AVT17

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch for Home use
customer_reviews.text: The MX700 does exactly what I wanted. We have 3 computers (2 wireless), and needed to be able to set up a network. Set up was easy and the 2 laptops can print from anywhere in the house. The fax at this price was very nice as well. I am not very concerned about printing photos, but the MX700 did a fine job when asked to. You cant go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Gryz

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: only had a few weeks, but works well. somewhat unusual paper tray,i.e. one in front , one in back. instructions book not as clear as could be.
customer_reviews.author: John A. de Planque

customer_reviews.title: The best yet
customer_reviews.text: I reccomend this printer particularly to those persons not wanting to have to make adjustments to make any electronic machine work right for them. This is why I call my review, "the best yet" You will love this machine for its simplicity and its excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo Puccini

customer_reviews.title: prints well, but the documentation is lacking
customer_reviews.text: had to do a lot of figuring out to make this thing work well. ie print and fax. still trying to figure a way to fax from leopard, and awaiting my router to see if it can a a network printer. so 3 stars so far for difficulty in setup and ease of use. could drop further....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the Canon Pixma printer. It scans excellent as well as all the other functions. Its alittle noisy buy other than that I would recommend it to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Agema

customer_reviews.title: It's "OK" but nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Prints and scans fine. What I don't like is it uses quite a bit of ink simply to start the printer for "cleaning" or warming up. Software is not intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: A very good buy over all, except it is a bit slow. Its wireless is a plus. INstalling software without any trouble. It works in 5 min. No regret!
customer_reviews.author: Wei

customer_reviews.title: What a great product AND deal!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace my 4 year old Epson. Read a great product review in PC World. Totally satisfied with printer performance. Price was lowest at AMAZON. com. Delivery was a day early. And FREE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg L

customer_reviews.title: Teacher Jan
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with this printer. My son set it up for me and has used the Fax and said that it worked fine. What I like is the speed of the printing. I hope I am happy with it 6 months from now.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Jan

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my new Cannon Pixma MX700 -  It is much more than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by my new Cannon Printer. The quality is excellent. The ease of use is exceptional and all in all it is a much better product that I expected. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Cave

customer_reviews.title: Overall good value
customer_reviews.text: Printer performs well and makes excellent copies. All features, fax - copy - scan, work well with some setup. I am using it on a wireless system. Print supplies are relatively expensive but quality of color copies is above average.
customer_reviews.author: only1putt

customer_reviews.title: Worked great right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, and easy to figure out the 4 basic functions. Replaced an Epson that failed after only 1 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gandolf

customer_reviews.title: Canon Printer Exceeds All Expectations
customer_reviews.text: What a machine.....does everything as advertised. Fast, compact, does it all. No wonder it is rated number one.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L. Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these that broke due to my own stupidity, loved it so much that I wanted an identical one so I found this on amazon and got it. Great all around all in one.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: PIXMA MX700
customer_reviews.text: I based my decision to purchase the Cannon on Product Reviews. My prior all-in-one printer was not very old, however, used excessive & expensive ink, required two color cartridges to print Black, would not recognize third party cartridges and forgot the customer was important. My MX700 is a "Professional Product".
customer_reviews.author: J. Munday

customer_reviews.title: The Absolute Worst Printer I've ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the worst printer I have ever bought. The printer worked fine for 3 months, then broke down. Customer service told me to buy more ink, which I did. Then they sent me more ink, and it still didn't work. Since it was still under warranty, they gave me a number to a shop 5 miles away to get it fixed. My printer is still broken. I've had it for almost a year, and used it for three months.I will never buy another canon product again, and I have warned all my friends and family against buying canon products. I used to buy Brother printers, and wanted to try something new. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter's Mac Powerbook Pro and it was easy to set up and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Mike

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MX700 Office All-On-One Inkjet Printer
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer This networkable 5-in-1 is all business, able to quickly produce beautiful photos and bold, professional-quality text. You can print photos right from compatible memory cards; selecting and enhancing images on the 1.8 inch color LCD display - or directly from a digital camera or DV camcorder. The Automatic Document Feeder (ADF) holds up to 30 originals, and two paper trays can store both plain and photo paper. You'll achieve up to Super G3 fax speed in color and B&W, and the expanded memory can store 40 speed dial codes and receive 100 incoming pages. Copies will be remarkably true to the originals, and when scanning photos you'll produce impressive 2400-dpi results, with vibrant 48-bit color depth.

 

The Canon Pixma MX700 All-In-One Printer offers:  * 4800 x 1200 dpi prints for spectacular detail and clarity. 
 * Print directly from compatible memory cards 
 * The Automatic Document Feeder (ADF) holds up to 30 originals. 







The networkable 5-in-1 MX700 is all business, able to quickly produce beautiful photos and bold, professional-quality text.. View larger. Superb Resolution 
To achieve 4800 x 1200 color dpi resolution, Canon Full-photolithography Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) uses a patented print head with 1,600 precision nozzles, ejecting ink droplets as small as 2 picoliters. The result: Amazing images.

Four High-Performance Ink Tanks 
This All-in-One uses four high-intensity dye-based color inks for rich photos and graphics, and a pigment black ink for clear, laser-quality text. Replace only the color that runs out, rather than a multi-color tank containing unused ink, helping to reduce your print costs. 

Fast Printing 
For extra productivity in the home or small office, you'll be able to produce up to 30 ppm black / up to 20 ppm color. You can also print a superb 4 x 6 inch borderless print in only about 46 seconds. 

Automatic Document Feeder
The built-in Automatic Document Feeder (ADF) holds up to 30 originals, so it's faster and easier to copy, scan or fax your larger documents. 

Auto Image Fix 
The built-in Auto Image Fix feature helps you produce amazing results on all your photos. First, it categorizes your images into one of five types - Portrait, Scenery, Night Scenery, Snapshot with Scenery, and Snapshot with Night Scenery - then applies optimal image correction accordingly. For example, it will automatically brighten faces that are backlit and underexposed, and correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones. 

 



Auto Image Fix ensures a good print every time. 
Two Paper Trays
Two built-in paper trays let you store photo paper and plain paper of different sizes - so you're always ready to print.

View, Edit and Enhance Images
With the 1.8 inchLCD screen you can view images on a compatible memory card without having to download them to your computer, then enhance them before printing. 

Network Connectivity
An Ethernet interface lets you connect to a home or office network, with connected computers sharing the use of this versatile machine. 

High Performance Faxing
This Office All-In-One achieves Super G3 Hi-speed fax in color and B&W, and its memory can store 40 coded speed dials and up to 100 incoming pages. 

Print from Memory Cards / Cameras
Want to print photos directly from a compatible memory card without using your computer? Just insert the card into a built-in slot, select images on the LCD display, and print! You can also print photos directly from your digital camera/DV camcorder.
feature_bullets: All-in-one printer can preview, scan, copy, print, and fax
Color resolution up to 4800 x 1200 dpi
Automatic Document Feeder holds up to 30 sheets of originals to easily copy, scan, or fax large documents
It has 1.8-inch color LCD photo preview display
